image.altText: A group of people in a room.

props.synopsis: Having survived an early election and another no-confidence motion straight after, Premier Jeremy Rockliff says he will focus on keeping the crossbench onside in the new Tasmanian parliament.

title.children: Tasmania's turmoil is finally over, as Rockliff promises to 'make it work'

image.altText: A composite image of Jeremy Rockliff and Dean Winter facing each other in parliament.

props.synopsis: Tasmanian Labor fails to unseat Liberal premier Jeremy Rockliff with not a single crossbencher voting for their no-confidence motion.

title.children: Tasmanian Liberals retain power as no-confidence motion defeated

image.altText: Jacquie Petrusma is named Speaker of the House of Assembly on 19 August 2025

props.synopsis: The Liberal MP was chosen to serve as the new Speaker of the House of Assembly over Labor nominee Jen Butler as Tasmanian parliament returned for its first sitting day following the snap election.

title.children: Jacquie Petrusma chosen as speaker as Tasmanian parliament returns

image.altText: Trucks drive into the Grange Resources mining pit at Savage River, Tasmania

props.synopsis: An iron-ore mine on Tasmania's north-west coast plans to move its operations underground by 2035, in a push that would improve the longevity and carbon footprint of the mine — but at the likely cost of jobs.

title.children: Tasmanian open-cut mine to shift underground in pursuit of net zero

image.altText: a man with brown hair and glasses in a blue checked shirt

props.synopsis: Artificial eye maker Jack McDonald has been ordered to stop operating while the Health Complaints Commissioner in Victoria continues an investigation into him.

title.children: Artificial eye maker ordered to stop working while investigation underway

image.altText: A high school student poses with her mobile showing her social media applications.

props.synopsis: While social media is a popular way to share information, Crime Stoppers and police are warning about the potential risks of sharing crimes online.

title.children: Dobbing in a criminal? Don't do it on social media

image.altText: A map of the Gaza strip showing areas in orange that have been issued evacuation orders by the IDF since March.

props.synopsis: By stitching together the so-called "evacuation orders" issued by the Israel Defense Forces, it is possible to see just how much of Gaza Israel has already taken.

title.children: IDF displacement orders suggest Israel's ultimate plan for Gaza

image.altText: A sign marks The Wesley Hospital.

props.synopsis: Rosemarie Campbell, who died three days after having gastric bypass surgery, was described as a dedicated grandmother during a coronial inquest into her death in Brisbane.

title.children: Patient's husband says she told him surgery may have been a 'mistake' before death

image.altText: A woman and man inspect a black t-shirt on a mannequin

props.synopsis: Australian fashion brands that are stocked in the US are wearing the burden of the higher tariffs on Chinese made goods. And as uncertainty continues, some brands are walking away from the lucrative market.

title.children: Austrade accused of abandoning Australian businesses amid trade war

image.altText: Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell smile for a photo, with Jeffrey’s arm around Ghislaine’s shoulder

props.synopsis: The Justice Department has agreed to provide Congress some documents from the Jeffrey Epstein sex trafficking investigation, though it is unclear exactly which or how many documents might be produced.

title.children: Some Jeffrey Epstein files to be released to Congress, House member says

image.altText: Police at shooting scene

props.synopsis: Witnesses have told police the man was shot while getting into his car at Winston Hills in Sydney's west on Tuesday evening.

title.children: Man dead after second Sydney shooting in two days

image.altText: An elderly woman sitting at a table wearing a blue jacket and white shirt underneath.

props.synopsis: The last remaining banking branch is about to close its doors in this regional town, leaving older Australians and businesses stranded.

title.children: Banks accused of taking people's 'independence away' via closures

image.altText: keshav maharaj celebrates a wicket for south africa

props.synopsis: Spin was king in Cairns as veteran South Africa tweaker Keshav Maharaj decimated Australia with a career-best haul in the first ODI.

title.children: Proteas spinner's brilliance triggers Aussie collapse

image.altText: A woman has long brown hair, she looks solemn. She wears earrings which read "stop violence against women"

props.synopsis: Advocates and people with lived experience have welcomed the findings of South Australia's Royal Commission into Domestic, Family and Sexual Violence, but say it's now up to the state government to reform the system.

title.children: Findings of SA royal commission welcomed by survivors and advocates

image.altText: A woman is standing up looking at a laptop.

props.synopsis: Former childcare workers at a centre where a man is alleged to have sexually assaulted two children speak out about a culture of secrecy in the centres.

title.children: Goodstart workers 'disgusted' with childcare complaints handling in abuse case

image.altText: Year 6 girl and boy sitting in dark blue school uniform on a brown sofa

props.synopsis: One in five of the students admitted to NSW's prestigious selective schools this year came from disadvantaged groups, but ABC analysis shows that the schools one expert calls the "jewel in the crown" of NSW education remain the domain of privileged students.

title.children: Areas of Sydney where most selective high school applications come from

image.altText: Elderly Caucasian-looking man, slight smile, teeth showing, thinning hair combed back, grey temples, suit, tie, blue background.

props.synopsis: The death of an accused paedophile, once a respected community leader, has left scores of alleged victims suing the State of New South Wales over child sexual abuse dating back decades.

title.children: Late former mayor linked to scores of child sex abuse civil claims

image.altText: a man sits close to a webcam in a turtle neck jumper

props.synopsis: The Saudi-born suspect faces charges of murder and attempted murder after allegedly driving his SUV into a crowded market in the city of Magdeburg.

title.children: Over 300 charges levelled at alleged German Christmas market attacker

image.altText: Two men sign a document at a table.

props.synopsis: Australia has pressed Nauru for more detail about a claimed billion-dollar investment agreement that it has signed with a mysterious Chinese company, as federal government officials scramble to ensure the Pacific nation is not breaching a landmark treaty it signed with Australia just nine months ago.

title.children: Billion-dollar Chinese investment proposed in Nauru sparks concern in Canberra

image.altText: The outside of a premises with a blue banner reading "health clinic and pharmacy" "cohealth"

props.synopsis: This community health organisation is having to cancel appointments when it rains, as the roof leaks, making rooms uninhabitable.

title.children: Dilapidated infrastructure holding community health services back

image.altText: A close up of plant species in two jars with white cloth on top.

props.synopsis: Researchers say it’s like Han Solo from Star Wars coming out from carbon freezing, but doing it for plants.

title.children: How cryopreservation is being used to save critically endangered tree

image.altText: Beth Mooney of Manchester Originals looks where the ball she hit is going

props.synopsis: Australian Beth Mooney has starred with the bat and gloves to help the Manchester Originals defeat the Trent Rockets in The Hundred.

title.children: Mooney stars with bat and gloves in The Hundred

image.altText: a woman wearing a navy blue dress and large sunglasses exiting court

props.synopsis: Sebastian Robinson's mother, Noelene Chellingworth, tells jurors in Darwin that Mr Wright tried to pressure her son into doctoring flight records while he was laid up in hospital after the 2022 accident.

title.children: Pilot's mother denies 'pointing the finger at Matt Wright' to protect son

image.altText: Trucks drive into the Grange Resources mining pit at Savage River, Tasmania

props.synopsis: An iron-ore mine on Tasmania's north-west coast plans to move its operations underground by 2035, in a push that would improve the longevity and carbon footprint of the mine — but at the likely cost of jobs.

title.children: Tasmanian open-cut mine to shift underground in pursuit of net zero

image.altText: A man warms up with an AFL ball

props.synopsis: Adelaide veteran Taylor Walker says a verdict is expected to be handed down on Tuesday into an alleged homophobic slur made by teammate Izak Rankine as calls ramp up to stop discrimination in sport.

title.children: Teammate says Rankine 'remorseful', as Crows await AFL investigation findings

image.altText: A man smiles at a camera while at a hospital. He sits in a chair and has a canula in his arm.

props.synopsis: A few months ago, Bugs bassist Jordan Brunoli was diagnosed with "incurable" stage 4 colorectal cancer. Now he and his band mates are warning other young people about the symptoms to watch for.

title.children: A 29-year-old Triple J star has 'incurable' colorectal cancer. What are the symptoms?

image.altText: an australian navy warship sails next to a philippine navy ship

props.synopsis: An Australian Navy destroyer joins ships from the Philippines and Canada for a joint sail in the South China Sea, an area of flaring tensions following a collision between two Chinese vessels last week.

title.children: Australian Navy destroyer joins military exercise in South China Sea

image.altText: two men sit in a gold-adorned room with their heads close together

props.synopsis: On the tortured and land-mined road to peace in Ukraine, this remarkable day of lobbying at the White House is as close to a good day as you can get.

title.children: Battle for Ukraine has become as much about Trump as it is the battlefield

image.altText: Various electronic appliances with a young girl on a orange backdrop

props.synopsis: The investigation comes as CHOICE filed its first 'super complaint' to the ACCC in May, flagging concerns that energy retailers use words like 'saver' for plans that are far from the cheapest.

title.children: ACCC investigates energy retailers over misleading savings claims

image.altText: Boxes tied to the body of a military jet.

props.synopsis: Indonesia marked its Independence Day by sending almost 18 tonnes of essentials into Gaza with the help of the Jordanian air force, but how effective was the "special gift" to the Muslim nation's "brothers and sisters"?

title.children: Indonesia airdrops 'special gift' to Gaza amid starvation crisis

image.altText: A white page with red border, red and grey iinet, connect better logo, house logo with residential underneath, skyscraper.

props.synopsis: A list of about 280,000 active email addresses and roughly 20,000 active landline phone numbers have been extracted from iiNet's order management system.

title.children: Cyber attack exposes details of more than 200,000 iinet customers

image.altText: A sign that says the supreme court fo queensland and district court of queensland below art that depicts eyes.

props.synopsis: The court heard the girl has "repeatedly" expressed the view that she does not want to continue with the pregnancy.

title.children: Judge rules 11yo should be allowed to have abortion

image.altText: Two serious young men, sit on window of grey metal building, one holds the other, white dog, black markings, plants.

props.synopsis: Josh Heins and Manu Bohn believe their tiny home on wheels does not need approval, but their local council does not agree.

title.children: Couple faces eviction amid calls for clarity on laws for tiny homes
